alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 02 at 1:18PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: .Areas of heavy rainfall expected through Sunday across Wallowa County, with previous years` burn scars vulnerable to localized flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Wallowa County. * WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Burn scars from 2022 fires can be prone to flash flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 0.5 to 1 inches with localized amounts of 1.5 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
